user.biography: Founded by @AlGore, we’re bringing the world together to stop climate change and create a healthy and prosperous future powered by clean energy. 🌎

node.text:
Repost @blackmillennials4flint - April 25, 2021 marks 7 years since the switch to the Flint River causing a manmade disaster that will impact generations to come. Sign our petition: bit.ly/justice4Flint

---------------
Check the links in our bio to sign the petition and to support @blackmillennials4flint!

node.text:
“We cannot have climate justice without racial justice.” Our founder and chairman, @algore, sat down with @greengirlleah and @intersectionalenvironmentalist to talk all things climate justice, activism, and how to get involved at our upcoming Virtual US Training. 

If you’re in the US and ready to take the next step in your climate advocacy, sign up to join the training by Friday, March 26 at the link in our bio! It’s your chance to join an amazing global network of 31,000+ changemakers and activists and to learn from leaders like Vice President Gore and Leah how we can put justice at the heart climate action. Sign up today, before registration ends: climaterealityproject.org/training.

node.title: Ask Al Gore: Intersectional Environmentalist x Climate Reality

node.text: Looking to see more from @amandascgorman after her incredible poem at President Biden’s inauguration? Check out “Earthrise” – a stirring poem about the climate crisis and why we need to fight for our planet – from our 24 Hours of Reality broadcast in 2018.

node.text: The climate fight starts at the grassroots level. To learn more about climate justice and our Climate Reality Leadership Corps trainings, make sure to check out @steph_shep’s interview with our founder and chairman, former Vice President @algore.

node.text: Exposure to fossil fuel pollution has been linked to several serious respiratory and cardiac diseases – which are among the leading conditions tied to the worst health outcomes for patients with COVID-19. This is just one of the many reasons why the #ClimateCrisis is also a #HealthCrisis.

node.text: It’s time to take climate action now! Want to learn from former US Vice President @algore , leading climate scientists, and community leaders on how to become a grassroots climate advocate in your community? The deadline to apply to our Climate Reality Leadership Corps training in San Antonio is coming up! Apply today with the link in our bio ➡️🌎

node.title: Attend our upcoming training in San Antonio!

node.accessibility_caption: The UN is out with a new report on the climate crisis. And it’s not pretty.

node.text:
🚨This is a climate crisis.🚨 

Plain and simple. And the @UN’s new landmark IPCC report makes clear: we can’t wait a second longer. 

We’re already locked in to some warming, but we can act now to avoid the worst of it — and Congress needs to step up. Go to the link in our bio to tell your senators we need real climate action NOW. 🗣

node.accessibility_caption: The UN is out with a new report on the climate crisis. And it’s not pretty.

The IPCC report says: 

We’re on track to pass 1.5°C of warming sooner than expected — and 2°C might not be far behind. 

More warming is locked in, based on the greenhouse gases we’ve already emitted. 

Extreme weather and sea-level rise are accelerating as a result of human-driven climate change. 

Source: https://bit.ly/3yBPILN
But there’s hope. The report makes clear we can still avoid the worst of the climate crisis ... if we act within a narrow window. That means now.
Take action: tell Congress we need big, bold climate action and we need it NOW! bit.ly/no-climate-no-deal.

An image of people protesting for climate action, with a sign that says "Fighting for our Future." A logo says: Climate Reality Leadership Corps Global Training 2021."

Text reads:
Be part of the solution to the climate crisis. Join the Climate Reality Leadership Corps: ClimateRealityProject.org/training.

node.text:
🗣 FREE CLIMATE ADVOCACY TRAINING! 🗣 

This is the moment for global climate action — and it’s going to take all of us standing together for real climate justice. Join the @ClimateReality Leadership Corps and get the knowledge, skills, and network to #LeadOnClimate at our virtual global training this October! 

It's all online and completely free. Sign up today at the link in our bio!

node.accessibility_caption:
Cartoon image of two people lifting a globe.

Text reads:
We can solve the climate crisis. We just need the will to act.

node.text:
We can do this. We have the solutions. But we have to act — fast. ⚡️

Right now, Congress is considering a budget that would go big on climate action, with real funding for clean energy and a new clean electricity standard that would move the US off fossil fuels fast. It’s a big deal, and they need to know we support bold climate action. 

🗣 Go to the link in our bio to contact your senators and tell them: Go big on climate! #NoClimateNoDeal

🚨🚨 Leading climate scientists are sounding the alarm. The climate crisis is here, and it’s worse than projections anticipated. 

The good news? We can still avoid the worst of the climate crisis — but we have to act NOW. Add your name at the link in our bio to tell Congress: we have to go big on real, transformative climate action right now. #NoClimateNoDeal

node.accessibility_caption:
Notebook paper with an image of a wildfire behind it.

Text reads:
Dear Congress,
What more reason do you need to act on climate?
(Asking for a planet.)
Love,
Nature

Tell Congress: Go BIG On Climate.
Sign here: bit.ly/no-climate-no-deal

node.text:
Congress, are you listening? 

Tell Congress to go BIG on climate action at the link in our bio!

node.accessibility_caption:
White and green text on a green background, over an image of a city in the mountains.
Text reads:
Welcome to more than 3,300 new Climate Reality Leaders!

node.text:
🌎 This month, thousands of people from across Latin America came together online for climate action at our first-ever virtual Latin America training! 

To everyone who helped make this training a success: thank you. 🙏 And to the more than 3,300 new members of the Climate Reality Leadership Corps: welcome! We can’t wait to see how you #LeadOnClimate in your community and around the world. 

🔗 We’ve got more virtual training opportunities coming soon, so head to the link in our bio to be the first to hear when registration opens! 👀👀

White and green text on a green background, over an image of a city in the mountains.

Welcome to more than 3,300 new Climate Reality Leaders!

White text on a teal background, with an image of a globe and a thermometer.

Text reads:
The climate crisis is already here. And we need to act.

node.text:
The climate crisis isn’t some far-off threat. It's HERE. And communities around the world are feeling its impacts. 

But the solutions are here too: a just transition to clean energy, investments in environmental and climate justice, clean energy jobs, rapid decarbonization, and so much more. We just need to act! 

Go to the link in our bio to find a @ClimateReality chapter near you and join the fight for real climate action NOW!

node.accessibility_caption:
An image of a protestor raising a fist. White and red texts on white and red backgrounds.

Text reads:
TELL CONGRESS:
This is our moment to go big on climate!

#NoClimateNoDeal
climaterealityproject.org/noclimatenodeal

node.text:
Right now, real climate action is possible. Congress is considering a budget proposal that goes big on clean energy jobs and a fossil fuel-free electric grid. We know Big Polluters are going to come at it with everything they’ve got — but we’re not backing down. 💪 

🔗 Go to the link in our bio to tell your senator: GO BIG ON CLIMATE NOW! ⚡️⚡️ 

#NoClimateNoDeal

node.text:
🚨 The climate crisis is HERE — and it’s not going to wait for us to act.
——————————————————
Repost @climatepower: 5,770 June temperature records—gone. We can't wait for bold action.

clips_music_attribution_info.should_mute_audio_reason: Instagram music isn't available in your region.

node.accessibility_caption: A stock image of a wildfire burning in California.

node.text:
Devastating wildfires from California to Siberia. Catastrophic flooding from India to Europe. Record-breaking droughts from the US to Madagascar. We can’t ignore the way the climate crisis is impacting real people worldwide right now. 🗣

Check the link in our bio for your free e-book on the connection between extreme weather and the climate crisis 📚
Around the world, we’re seeing terrifying heat waves. But the impacts aren’t felt equally – and it’s why we need REAL climate justice. ✊

node.accessibility_caption:
The climate crisis is making heatwaves more intense, frequent, and dangerous.“Every heatwave occurring today is made more likely and more intense by human-induced climate change.”  
- Friederike Otto | University of Oxford 
Source: bit.ly/3xqN7n6

And the legacy of racist policies like redlining have put people of color at even great risk. As one study puts it:  

“Land surface temperatures in redlined areas are approximately 2.6 °C warmer than in non-redlined areas.”  

Source: bit.ly/3yCTLHi

In 2015 alone, an estimated 175 million more people were exposed to dangerous heatwaves than in a historically average year. 

It’s the climate crisis, playing out in real time. 

Source: bit.ly/2T0ASyO

But the effects aren’t felt equally.  

Poor families and the elderly as well as people living in cities, with asthma or other conditions, or with polluted air are most at risk. 

Source: bit.ly/3AHaY4c

Globally, less wealthy countries and those in the Global South are even more vulnerable. 
And as temperatures rise, the threat is only getting more severe. 
Source: bit.ly/3hLxuQF
We must act for climate justice. Now.
Land and human rights defenders are fighting for environmental justice in Latin America

node.text:
Throughout Latin America, people are standing up for environmental justice, Indigenous rights, and our shared future. 🌎 We’re so honored to have some of the region’s land and human rights defenders sharing their knowledge and experiences as part of our virtual Latin America training. 

If you’re attending the training, be sure to tune in to hear from these remarkable speakers during the following sessions: 
👉 Land Defenders: Voices of Latin America 
👉 The Faces of Climate Action in Latin America 
👉 Climate Change and Justice at the Center of the Forced Migration Crisis in Latin America 

🔗 Registration for this training is closed, but we have more virtual trainings coming up soon! Click the link in our bio to be the first to hear when future trainings open.

node.accessibility_caption: Land and human rights defenders are fighting for environmental justice in Latin America

“The ancestors taught that life and nature must be in balance; we must be one. I fight for the life and balance of our generations.” 

Carla Garcia | Black Fraternal Organization of Honduras (OFRANEH) 

Image of Carla Garcia

“As a Qom woman, I consider my territory to be my identity, strength, origin and destination. That is why I fight against projects that harm and deforest our lands.” 

Bernarda Pesoa | Organization of Peasant and Indigenous Women (CONAMURI) 

Image of Bernarda Pesoa

“I defend life, the environment, and the climate because big conversations aren’t just for adults; we can all use our citizenship for life.” 

Francisco Vera | youth climate activist 

Image of Francisco Vera

“I fight for the Argentine state to have a respectful and direct dialogue with the Indigenous peoples. I call for intercultural dialogue on the basis of current legislation that is not being complied with.” 

Félix Díaz | Consultative and Participatory Council of Indigenous Peoples in Argentina 

Image of Félix Díaz

“I fight with all the strength of my heart, generating hope in the face of today’s somber outlook, climate action, a wave of love for the planet.” 

Pati Ruiz Corzo | Grupo Ecológico Sierra Gorda (GESG) 

 Image of Pati Ruiz Corzo
